title: Refactoring Pinot segment upload
body:
* Refactoring the upload code to be a set of interfaces that have different implementations across different upload types and universal utils classes that are used for all types.
* Makes it easier to add new features, such as ways to encrypt/decrypt segments.
* Added an integration test for URI upload. Note that this upload method intentionally behaves differently from the old URI upload in that it always will move the segment to a controller-dictated final directory.
* URI upload will always go through the JSON content-part endpoint since the multipart endpoint will throw errors
* Changed the current multipart endpoint and json segment upload endpoints to go through my new upload method.

* Future work
1. Add metadata upload type as an optimization
2. In this PR, I removed support for segment names with strange characters. The reason for this is because we are now using a URI abstraction. That means that the final segment resting place will have to fit into the URI abstraction and will require the filename to be encoded as well. Will need to do a bigger change to support that, aka, store segments as their encoded names both in zk metadata and in their file paths/look into that more and did not want to do that as part of this pr.

title: Enhance service status check
body:
Refactor ServiceStatus for the following fix and enhancement:
1. When ideal state is null (resource has been removed), should return GOOD (fix)
2. Do not fail when partitionStateMap is empty because the instance might be removed from the resource (fix)
3. Log the correct number of resources left to be checked (fix)
4. Keep only the resources not checked in memory to reduce garbage (enhancement)
5. Log an ERROR message when partition get into ERROR state (enhancement)

title: Invalidate controller leader cached value if exceptions occur during segment completion calls
body:
We recently faced an error scenario on perf controller. The leader controller was taken down. The servers cache the leader controller value, until a NOT_LEADER response is received, after which the cached value gets refreshed. 
But in this scenario, since the controller was down, it could not send NOT_LEADER. We threw an exception, but never refreshed the controller leader cached value.
The servers kept trying to send requests to the controller who they thought was the leader, and we never recovered from this. The only way out was a server restart.

Adding logic to invalidate and refresh caches in exception scenarios

title: [TE] frontend - aaronucsd/added 401 error handling and login session …
body:
…expired catches

1. Added 401 handling for ember data and non-ember data routes
2. Added better login message for session expired
3. Retained force url or deep links (fromUrl) to support things like bookmarks and emails
4. Added the logic to handle saving intented transition prior to session timed out
5. Added error substates in all routes. Most children route will bubble the error to its parent and
parents to application route.
6. manual tests
7. Important note: We need to still find all fetch() that isnt' using `checkStatus` to use it.
However, it is important to note that `checkStatus` already does the response.json so we do not need to call it explicitly like below.
```
        fetch(url)
          .then(checkStatus)
          .then(res => res.json())
          .then(res => this.set('selectedMetric', res));
```

The line `.then(res => res.json())` needs to be removed.

![screen shot 2018-08-27 at 4 01 54 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8840761/44691693-8d361600-aa14-11e8-86b4-1d29a1caa670.png)

title: Making segment upload changes for move
body:
* During segment upload, we want URI upload to always move segment to a permanent directory so that we can have full control over deletion, operations, etc
* Also, we want all segment uploads to come through the controller if there is any movement that needs to occur, aka, if the segment is not in its final resting place in remote storage. Reasoning for this is we want the flexibility to upload to/from different kinds of filesystems. Eventually, we will also want to support download from https since some remote storages support that as well.
* Integration test is WIP, but putting up for early review

title: [TE] dimension analysis and report anomaly bug fixes
body:
In this pass, bug fixes:
- Handling consistency issue in going from home dashboard into a specific alert page. Previously, two different methods of deriving start/end dates for the anomalies request resulted in a discrepancy between number of anomalies reported and number of anomalies shown in the table. This is now resolved.
- Dimension analysis table. Deriving the associated metric Id from metric URN instead of from passed component property "metricId". Now, consistency in parsing metricId in order to display dimension options (to include/exclude)
- Alert page: report anomaly modal cancel button is now working. Also, added query param to enable direct link to report missing anomaly task.

title: [TE] callgraph - rca pipeline
body:
* RCA pipeline for call graph analysis with arbitrary edges for traffic counts and latency metrics

* extension of data source capabilities to push down filter requirements

The call graph pipeline analyzes changes in the mean latency of caller-callee edges between two timestamps. Larger *absolute* changes in the mean latency rank higher. Additionally, the pipeline supports filtering of edges with invalid (negative) count or latency values at the data source level.

title: Reduce heap usage during segment builds
body:
While measuring heap allocations during segment builds, jmap showed
sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Decoder and sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Encoder among the top
40 objects in both size and number of instances. In 4 use internal use cases
the jmap output had these numbers, allocated during segment creation
(in most cases, there were in the top 5 in terms of memory)

Use case 1:
 num     #instances         #bytes  class name
----------------------------------------------
   3:      26459379     1058375160  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Decoder
   7:       5592818      313197808  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Encoder

Use case 2:
   2:        950923       38036920  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Decoder
   30:          2349         131544  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Encoder

Use case 3:
   3:       5385769      215430760  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Decoder

Use case 4:
   5:       5407753      216310120  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Decoder
   7:       2016142      112903952  sun.nio.cs.UTF_8$Encoder

Upon closer look, it appears that the call String.getBytes("UTF-8") caches the
decoder in a ThreaLocal variable in StringCoding class, whereas the call to String.getBytes(Charset)
ends up creating a new decoder everytime.

Same with encoder calls.

It should help to cache the encoder/decoder in query path as well.

This change replaces calls to encode/decode Strings to utf8 with a method in
StringUtil class.

After the change, the decoder/encoder do not appear in the top objects.

title: [PINOT-6701] Controller API to check storage quota before segment upload
body:
Expose a controller API to check storage quota before segments are uploaded. The API expects, as a query parameter, the uncompressed size of all segments that are to be uploaded. The API accounts for the appropriate push-type (refresh vs append) and whether the segments to be uploaded have indices or not and returns whether the upload can go through or not.

Eventually, we will drop the quota checks that are done per segment and expect all push jobs to call this API before starting the upload. That will save a lot of unnecessary calls to the servers for get table sizes as well as prevent partial uploads if the size is exceeded mid way through the segments push.

Testing Done: added integration test that covers the append use-case upload. Plan to add more after initial review.

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: [PINOT-6856]: Fix controller storage check logic when it is unable to get reports from servers
body:
Currently, when the controller fails to get a segment size report from any replica for a given segment, it falls back to using the table-level max. The problem with that is that for highly skewed tables, we can overestimate by a lot and cause segment uploads to fail.

It appears that it might be safer to let the upload go through in such cases, than try to extrapolate sizes based on existing sizes. Depending on which segments we actually get reports back from using, mix/max/average/median etc can always be vulnerable to overestimation.

With this change, we skip segments where we have no report from any replica. For segments that have report from some, but not all, we fill in for the other replicas using the segment-level-max (it should be extremely rare that replicas report different sizes for segments!)

Changes include:
- Firing off a metric when we skip quota enforcement when we don't hear back from any server at all.
- Firing off a metric when we go through with quota enforcement with partial reports. We still go through with the check as it can help catch cases where the table is already over quota even with the existing reports.
- Added a missingSegments count to track how many segments we don't have reports for at all.
- Fixed test to add coverage for missing segments.

title: Fix error logs in ServerTableSizeReader
body:
When we encounter exception while retrieving the result of a http call via completion service, we don't have a good way of determining the server uri of the original request. The earlier code used the loop counter to figure out the server, which has nothing to do with the task that the completion service can return.

This change removes the server ids from the logs as the current logs are incorrect.

title: Revert "Remove using http connection pool in table-size api path
body:
This reverts commit d4fb2e0cb4c6c1bee69aa6452e4690e30f308829.

As silly as this sounds, this commit was based on an incorrect log line :(. Will fix the logs in another PR.

Also, turns out that we don't have any limits on the thread-pool used for making out bound connections, so removing the connection pool as well results in unbounded connections being made.

title: Reduce heap allocation during realtime segment creation
body:
In order to calculate min and max values of a no-dictionary column we walk through the entire value set,
allocating a good bit of heap memory. But then we really don't use the value generated.
The getMin() and getMax() methods are called only to construct ColumnIndexCreationInfo (the values
gathered from columnStatistics are stored in the ColumnIndexCreationInfo object). But then
the min/max values from ColumnIndexCreationInfo are retrieved only for the time column and not for
any other column. Time column is never a no-dictionary column, so we can remove all the code in the
no-dictionary column to compute min-max.

This essentially reverts #1468, which was submitted because of review comments on #1462.
Comment on #1462 should now be addressed, because we now throw exception instead of returning
some invalid value.
